fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • Errors in names have crept into some recent pieces. A report about Caffè Greco facing closure listed “Sophia Lauren” as a customer of Rome’s oldest cafe. The Italian actor Sophia Loren was meant (Drinking in history, 19 October, page 4). Joanna Scanlon’s character in The Accident was called Angela, not Anna as a review of the TV drama said (25 October, page 18, G2). And a Weatherwatch column gave the last name of Michael Peterson, of the Los Alamos National Laboratory, as “Petersen” (29 October, page 40). • Other recently corrected articles include: ‘Old-fashioned sketch comedy has a very white sensibility’: the race row that rocked Cambridge Footlights ‘We want to keep our forest’: why Guyana’s wilderness needs visitors 10 of the best tiny castles in the UK
